It was sweet corn and cheddar and the flavor overtook the meat at times. It was too much for the perfectly cooked short rib.  Let me preface this as saying, most of the descriptions are simple so you really are not sure what you are getting.  I ordered the Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee for dessert. It said brownie and raspberry preserves. I was NOT expecting that to be in the creme brulee. It was awful. There was no saving grace or that dessert. Too much happening and the components did not work together. I was sad for it.

If you are a huge wine fan, this is one of your best bets in Madison. The food is five star, the service is good, but the prices are high.  It's located in a strip mall, which strips away a little of the elegance.  If you can get past that, and have money to spend, this is a great place to hang with a group of good friends, impress a date, or bring a wife as a last minute surprise.  Know it is trying to be fancy, so dress up a little and enjoy the evening.

This place is excellent! Great wine list and Happy Hour till 7pm. Try the Cigar Zinfandel or the Ghost Pines blend. Amazing!  The appetizers are great too and come out fast. The service is incredibly good.   Don't let the outside deceive you (strip mall) because the inside is very classy, as you can see by photos.    I only give 4 stars instead of 5 because I have yet to try a majority of the food. But I will work on that :-D

Wow, who knew you could find a place like this in Madison, Wi!!! This is SF, NYC quality. I mean from the drinks and appetizers to the main dish to the dessert, the service, the atmosphere, the parking, and so on. Outstanding. Sherman the waiter was so knowledgeable and easy on the eyes, great service. The atmosphere was quiet enough for a group of 8 to actually hear each other. The St Michele Cab was super yummy. The scallops, sea bass, steak special, chocolate lava cake type dessert, all yumalicious. Recommend this for bdays, special events, family, friends, business or just to get some good food. If I lived in Madison, I would eat here all the time! ps parking is super duper easy...comes with the territory I guess :)

This, my friends, is where you take a woman if you're hoping for a second date.  And a third.  etc.  This place is pricey, yes.  Its worth every penny.    I had a wine there and I've never been able to find again.  Its a sparkling white with definite sweet pear overtones.  If anyone can help, please please write me.

With great ambience, an impressive tapas selection and excellent wine list, Eno Vino exceeded my expectations. The plates actually range from tapas size to meal size as you go down the list - we ordered 2 of the larger plates plus crab cakes as an app and it was plenty. Their presentation is impeccable. We were impressed with our wine selections, especially the Madrigal Zinfandel.   We plan to go back to try their pizzas.

We love Eno Vino! We travel from about 3 hours away every September for our anniversary weekend in Madison and ALWAYS go here. We are excited to see the new upgrades! We will actually be visiting in a couple weeks and going to order out since we will have our small children with this time around but we can't wait to have their food again!

The renovation is everything I expected and more! They transformed an already tasteful and inviting space to a modern, sophisticated, and timeless atmosphere.  They've mastered the craft of a casual happy hour, first date, anniversary, or a "just because" kind of dining experience.  Cheers to revamping the old with an incredibly new vision on hospitality!

This place just has it.  Ambiance, service, food, and drinks were all fantastic.  Their happy hour is great and perfect for trying a few of their dishes.  My husband loved the maple bourbon manhattan.  They have a great wine and cocktail list.  Special occasion or not, you should try this place.

Absolutely love their creative food options and extensive wine list! We went for the first time for my fiance's birthday and went back a week later with friends we loved it so much! If you get a chance, try the coffee/mocha martini.... so delicious!

My boyfriend and I had had both been here previously and had high expectations, but we left disappointed. The sangria was OK, but had no fruit in it other than the small chunks they put in your glass full of ice. The shrimp "ceviche" was either cold, cooked shrimp with a salsa type mix or it was ceviche-esque but completely uncleaned. I might be picky, but I get grossed out when my shrimp is full of poop, and if it's supposed to be raw I would hope they clean it thoroughly. The service was awesome, the calamari fries were great, but everything else left much to be desired.

Hooray!  I love this place!  Fantastic wine menu and nice atmosphere.  Definitely an older crowd than I am used to (I'm 21 and the average age is 45) but the staff still treated me like a star.  My wine was delicious and my date and I ordered the fondu plate....best fondu plate I have EVER had...amazing!  Our bartender was new and not very familiar with the menu, but with 100's of wines to keep straight, I can't fault her.  I will definitely go back!  5 stars!

I have been to Eno Vino twice, once for an awkward first date and again to discuss marketing methods with a business contact.  On both occasions I was served, hands down, the best mojitos I've ever had--and I used to bartend.  I only ate there one of the two times, but I had the mushroom ravioli and the seared tuna.  I'm a huge mushroom and sushi fanatic, so these were great choices for me.  The seared tuna was a bit spicy for my taste, but I think table black pepper is too spicy, so don't take my word at face value.  The mushroom ravioli was one of the best mushroom dishes I've ever had.  Outstanding food and drinks, and to top it off, outstanding service -- I spoke with 4-5 servers that night and everyone was very friendly and accommodating.  If you don't like this place, you're out of your mind. 5 stars all day long.

Absolutely loved this place. A little spendy but left very full and the price was worth the quality of food and wine that we received! Service was also amazing! Will definitely be returning. Would recommend the wine flights too, they were a really good deal. Oh and get the lobster bisque , you won't regret it.
Seriously great food and craft cocktails!! Loved the truffle fries,  beef tenderloin bruschetta, Peachy Keen and Blackberry Bourbon Smash! Will definitely return.

One of Madison's safest bets for a nice dining experience.  It's not extraordinary, but the food is fine and the wine list is good, as everyone notes.    It's also one of the few restaurants in town that I could imagine staying in business in another city, such as Boston.  (Yes, I always play that game with my wife.  Namely: what's the largest city this restaurant could survive in? :)  The cuisine isn't innovative, but I have yet to have a bad meal here.  (And this is the only restaurant in Madison I can say that about.)  So, if you're going out for dinner or have guests from a "big city" who are used to "good" restaurants, Eno Vino is among Madison's most consistently good choices.

Decadent perfect Tapas ( non Spanish) prepared by Chefs who are true Chefs.  I had the honor on my last visit to meet the Chef who created the Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with Jalepeno Polenta accompanied by Blackberry reduction and Sweet Potatoe curls. There were or never will be words to describe this masterpiece.  The Pork is cooked to your specifications and the Polenta has the perfect flavor of the afore mentioned Pepper. Its creamy sublimeness melts in your mouth and makes you moan with pleasure.  The young chef who created the dish was humble and honest in his passion.Affter meeting him I knew I can never dine anywhere but here for genuine (sorry for the comparison) but" Iron Chef" Style Perfection.  If you are in dire need of experiencing the most amazing food in Madison, if you are a true foodie, do not hesitate to discover Eno Vino. I know for a fact that One of thee most talented True Chefs is located here.   So many of ENO Vino's creations are beyond words.  (note to Taylor) you rocked as our server Thank you so much!
I've enjoyed sharing plates every time I've been here. If the hanger steak (I believe) sounds good from the description, you won't be disappointed. Remember: sharing is caring.

Good wine, good food, good service - it's as simple as that.  We visited on a Saturday evening in June and sat on the patio.  In our group, we had a few different red wines and two martinis.  No disappointment there.  Food-wise, we shared bruschetta and flatbreads, both of which were delicious.  Only downsides are that the location is not very scenic (the patio faces a parking lot) and the interior lighting is super-dim, especially jarring if you were just out in the sunlight.

The food was really on point, although some what pricy, but I was there with some co workers for a work dinner so alls well that ends well (wellllll- paid for by my boss!).  Had some of the following and I really enjoyed it (we shared family style): -All of the Bruschetta had their individual merits/short comings; the tomatillo avocado, prosciutto, and mediterranean were my top three picks. -Truffled Fries -Sea Bass & Scallops -Hanger Steak (phenomenal) -Korean Short Rib Pot Stickers\ -Center Cut Filet (also phenomenal)  The desserts were somewhat disappointing, I would say load up on the plates to share : )

I've lived in Madison for over 5 years and this is still one of my favorites, if not the best. Some dishes are pricey for what you get (tenderloin, crab cakes), but the flatbreads, salads, cheese plate, and other dishes are exceptional and all a great price. If you enjoy blue cheese stuffed olives, they have the best you'll ever try.
Excellent selection on the menu. We haven't had anything like what we ordered before, but it was superb! Most things are meant to be shared. Great way to spark conversations. I plan to return soon.

More like E'Yes' Vino.   My wife and I wined and dined here for the first time this past week. We both felt that the service, wine selection, and food was absolutely incredible. Our experience there was one of the best we have ever had (that involved dinner, anyway).   We plowed through three tapas plates, (ahi tacos, calamari fries, and chicken skewers) and about half a Thai chicken flatbread, which was my favorite item. The food was out quicker than we expected and all the dishes were very flavorful and not too heavy.  As with most things in life, you get what you pay for, but even though the meal and wine plowed through our wallet a bit - we will definitely be back!
Food was absolutely amazing, great wine selection, and stellar service.  Next time I'm in Madison, I'll be back!

An almost perfect evening: we finally got a decent spring Saturday evening, so we wanted to dine outside. We had no problem getting a table at Eno Vino (although after I dropped my wife off, the hostesses ignored her (really, girls, is that how you want to be treated when you go out?)). If you enjoy cocktails with your dinner, this place takes cocktails as seriously as they take their wine. We never went into the restaurant itself, but evidently they were busy. That probably explains the length of time it took to get out bruschetta. However, the manager saved the evening from going south. He was attentive, and when he noticed the delay, he told us the item would be comped.  The menu is always very interesting with combinations that are original and delicious. In addition to the bruschetta, we had the truffle fires and the special risotto (pork belly) and tempura shrimp. We shared the cheesecake for dessert. All were great. We will continue to patronize this place!

We are still trying new spots in Madison and last night decided to stay on the west side instead of going downtown.  As soon as we pulled into this strip mall, my gut told me that we shouldn't have.    Upon entering, it was packed so I thought maybe I had misread it.  I didn't.  We ended up getting a seat at the bar which was great but the service at the bar (how?!?!) was very spotty.  The cocktail menu reminded me of a Cheesecake Factory or another horrible chain.  The wine choices were pretty good and we had a nice Barola- with no guidance from the staff.  As far as food, we had the baked goat cheese which was pretty good except it was about 5% cheese and 95% tomatoes.  The accompanying bread was excellent- too bad that may have been the highlight.  The beet salad was ok but could have benefitted from goat cheese- oh the irony.  The sausage pizza was pretty good but nothing to remember.  I wouldn't come back!

Great food and service...best meal I have had since arriving in the Madison area in april..get the pork belly..oxtail..just try everything..you will not be disappointed. The service was outstanding as well as a massive wine list..will definitely be back
Good food. Adequate service. Has slipped s bit   Still an experience  the flat iron steak was especially good!

After reading so many positive reviews, I expected much more from this place.  While the dish presentations were attractive and the flatbread was pretty good, the rest of our experience was unimpressive.  There are many other restaurants I would visit before considering a return to Eno Vino.

I came to Madison Wisconsin for training and my coworker raved about this place. We decided to check it out the first night after training, really enjoyed it and came back the next night.   Bruschetta: We started off with some bruschetta and they were so good.  We were able to choose any 4 of these and we selected the following:  Brie and Apple, Prosciutto (consists of Prosciutto, apricot jam, asparagus, and fontina), Fresh Mozzarella (tomato, basil, and aged balsamic), and Beef Tenderloin (caramelized onions, gruyere, and rosemary aioli).  My favs of from there were the Prosciutto and Beef Tenderloin.  The flavors of these really worked well.   Starters: We also shared a half order of the truffle fries and they were delicious.  The crab cakes here were to die for.  They were so flavorful and fresh.     Cocktail: I ordered the effen delicious cocktail which consisted cucumber vodka, basil, fresh watermelon, and lemonade.  It was really refreshing.    Our waitress was very attentive and answered all our questions.  Definitely a location I'll have to return to whenever I am in Madison again.
Good food.  Good service.  I like the atmosphere here and they always seems to be busy.  The bar draws a nice crowd.  My friends and I meet here alot for drinks and apps.

One of the best places I've been to in the area. Super friendly staff. Cozy restaurant. Sat at the bar and had the Korean BBQ pot stickers. Thought they were delish. Came with 3 pretty good dipping sauces. Also got the apple brie and Caribbean salsa bruschetta. It wasn't 5 star, but it was still really good. For dessert I had the brownie creme brul√©. Also good! And to top it off, they have a great wine and mixed drink selection:)

I went here with my parents and grandmother and we loved it! We got cocktails and all enjoyed them- I particularly liked my raspberry mule.  I think we also finished everything we ordered because everything was so good. My favorite was the tuna but the green beans were another favorite.  They recommended 2 or 3 per person so we went with 2 which was about portion wise. The server was attentive but not overbearing and overall it was a great experience!

Brought my friend here and we had the best time in Madison. Great fresh food. We had an excellent server. We ordered the seabass and scallops. Overall it was a wonderful evening although felt like the portions could have been larger. Will come back again.

We dined here twice in our week in Madison.  5* food, 5* service and 5* decor.  Thank you, Kenny, for helping me out with my numerous special requests.  Monday night, we enjoyed a half priced bottle of wine: Super Tuscan Luce Della Vite Lucente 2013, a Merlot/Sangiovese.  I highly recommend the smoked salmon bruschetta.  The other bruschettas I tried (brie/apples, tomatillo and Mediterranean) were fine but not as WOW as the salmon.  I loved the spinach salad with strawberries, goat cheese, granola. Best part was the orange &apricot vinaigrette, which I ordered on the side.  Best dressing I've had in a while.  I did hold the fried parsnips that were supposed to come with the salad.  The cheese plate is exceptional.  Comes with grapes, olives and other goodies. The blue cheese was my favorite.  Dessert menu could use an overhaul.  The gluten-free biscuit that comes with the peach cobbler is so vile, I wouldn't want to have it even if I needed GF.  To be fair, the waitress Jennifer was trying to hint that if I'm not GF, I might want to try a different dessert.  But I wasn't expecting the biscuit to be THAT bad.  The peach part of the cobbler is delicious.  Why can't they offer it with a normal crumb topping for the rest of us who don't need GF?  And wouldn't the GF diners prefer small crumbs of the GF topping rather than the huge, dry biscuit?  My criticism of the bread pudding is entirely unfair, since I ordered the ice cream in a separate bowl and it probably would have been fine with the ice cream dumped on top. However, it still would probably be better if the bread pudding had raisins or pineapple chunks (or both!) for both flavor and texture.  Without the ice cream, the bread pudding definitely needed something. Hey, this is Wisconsin and they serve everything with dairy and dairy with everything.

We went on a Saturday night during the holidays.  Busy place after 7 pm.  Great wine list on an Ipad.  Small plates were shared by the group of 4.  Started  out with a cheese board of 3 cheeses.  Very good.  Next had chicken scewers and pork belly biscuit.  Finished with a flat bread pizza with shrimp and Andouille sausage.  Very filling even after sharing.  Quite pricy but a nice evening out.   +/- $175.00 with tip.
Good time here. Service is good, not the fastest. Waiters outside smoking (5' from the door) swearing about their sections when we left. That was less than impressive.

Let me start off by saying that the food is ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL!  The thought and precision with which they plate is relatively unmatched in Madison.  So why three stars?  Despite the fact that the food looked amazing, nothing tasted as good as it should.don't get me wrong, the fish was freshen up and everything was cooked the way it should be, but for some reason many of the dishes in our tapas style meal just lacked the intensity of flavor I would expect from a top-tier restaurant.  The wine was terrific and I will go back to give it another chance.  I just wasn't amazed...until I got the bill.

Awesome tapas, drinks, mood and most importantly the service. We had small group that expanded to 12 people and they were very accommodating.  I would come back to this restaurant every time I was in town.

Back in Madison and at EnoVino again and I will say I have yet to be disappointed!! This time I had the risotto and even had a peach cobbler dessert! DELISH!!! they do have a happy hour in the bar so if you get there early enough (I think before 7pm) they have some nice deals! GO ENOVINO!!! Pleasee come to the East Coast!!

One of my favorite restaurants in all of Madison and for sure on the west side!! Service is always excellent. The staff are great at what they do. I love sitting at the bar for happy hour. Best happy hour in town. Best food. I'm a wine lover and they have like 300 different bottles and finest tequila and anything you want. Order the saut√©ed green beans, cheese board, any of the flat breads, pretty much anything is great. More of my favs are ahi tuna tacos, braised brisket, hanger steak, bay scallops, pork belly, bruschetta

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the braised pork belly.  It was so indulgent yet so incredible on top of its smoked gouda biscuit, topped with a fried egg.  It left us wanting more.  Oh, it was so good.  We also had the duck duet but weren't quite as impressed.  Maybe we're just not fans of duck.  I don't know.    The wines were good with a nice variety.  We particularly liked the Saviah "The Jack" from Columbia, Washington (2008 vintage), which is  a blend fashioned after Bourdeaux in France but much less stuffy and much less austere a wine than the Frenchies offer.     We were fortunate to be there during happy hour, which gave us a discount on each of our glasses of wine.  We were really happy about that!  The ambiance is dimly lit (the bartenders even needed a small flashlight to see or look for something), but warm nonetheless.  I wouldn't change a thing.  The service was attentive, polite, and pleasant.    I definitely want to make this a must-see stop whenever I visit Madison.

Great atmosphere and happy hour!! Although I'm highly disappointed that once a revived my food they never asked how was it. Even when they removed my plate not a word. I will say it was very good and I will be back for sure but I wish they would have just asked. Silly I know but important to me.
Soft romantic warm lighting, delightful full bodied red wine. Great place to warm up after being at Camp Randall for freezing graduation ceremony

Tapas in Madison, I thought NO WAY! YES WAY!!!  Great vibe, great food, great wine.  Def stop by for some great tapas and wine list, a bit overpriced...but hey there is a cost associated with decent food!

If tapas style small plates, a huge wine list, great service and an atmosphere you'd be surprised to see in Madison, WI entices you... you need to try this place. Trust me.  Yes, it's tucked in the corner of a strip mall looking building... in Middleton, WI... next to a Panera Bread... but still, just trust me. You'll love it.

I enjoy the taste of food at this restaurant more than I do anywhere else.  Although the prices are high, the food is surprising filling.  The tapas presentation is high class and fun to share.  The atmosphere is nice, and the service is quick.

My fianc√© and I ate here tonight after reading such good reviews.  This place does not disappoint.  Before I go into specifics, I'll say this: we've lived in NYC, DC, Philly, and Boston over the last 6 years and this place is as good as some of the best tapas bars in NYC.  The best part: being in a small town means you aren't dining in the next couple's laps like in NYC.  We had the bruschetta to start - all four that we tried were amazing.  I wasn't so sure whether I'd like the apple and fig but it was delicious - not too sweet and it paired well with the other types of bruschetta.  My fianc√© had the Kinda Blue cocktail and he honestly said it was one of the best cocktails he'd ever had.  Every dish we had was delicious.  My favorites include the stuffed piquillo peppers and the hanger steak.  Portions were perfect - usually we leave hungry from tapas bars, but I was happy-full when we left.   Please try it out - well worth the price =)

Shrimp & andouille flatbread is one of my favorite meals. Wine selection is very good & fairly priced. We've sat at the bar to eat a number of times & have always been disappointed with the service. Bartenders walking by without checking in & twice as it got later in the evening being completely ignored. It was obvious they thought it was time for us to leave.

Great tapas menu, supurb wine list, and greart specialty cocktails which I love on a warm summer night.  I had a mussels appetizer that came with crusty bread and it served as a meal for me.  Absolutely delicious.  This is a great placed to meet professional people as well.

The food at Eno Vino is exceptional, and once inside the strip-mall doors, the decor of this place is warm and elegant and not too crowded the night we reserved.  We came here for a celebration dinner after touring the U of W Grad School offices and it was an excellent choice.    The small plates selection was impressive!  We started with the baby spinach salad with figs, proscuitto, pistachios, and maple vinegar. It was certainly one of the best plates of the evening. Next we had the blackened mahi-mahi with mango butter and butternut jicama slaw. Perfectly done, melt-in your-mouth goodness.  My partner loved the lamb cheek sugo with caramelized fennel and feta, and I liked it too, even though I'm not a big fan of lamb. It came with a delicious herbed spaeztle. It's great to start seeing these noodles on restaurant menus!  Our last dish was a portabella mushroom ravioli with port wine cream and brandy-cured foie gras. It was spectacular. If we'd had any room, I would have ordered a second one, but the portions are ample and we were full.  Joe enjoyed a Picos del Montgo Tempranillo, from Spain, and a Sherwood Pinot Noir, from New Zealand. He loved both of them. I was happy with my Cavas but glad for a taste out of each of his glasses.  Altogether, it was a wonderful dinner - great food and a nice romantic evening. The only thing that marred it slightly was our server, who had an excess of personality and not enough work to do. He was a little obtrusive, but also knew the menu well and made excellent wine suggestions.

Eno Vino is really excellent. I've been twice this week so I guess that's saying something.  They have a great wine list to choose from, both by the glass and from the cellar--which is presented on an iPad. A very nice full bar to boot, which in my book means a good selection of scotches.  The food is great, but remember that it is presented in an appetizer or tapas like form. My favorite dish that I tried was the Ahi Tacos--had to have it again on the second visit.   Highly recommended. Just keep in mind that I think Eno Vino fits more of the "great place to meet people" than the "great place for a sit down dinner" category.

We always love this place.  Some nights it is packed and energetic and some night's not.  This past Saturday was not, likely because of the nice summer weather.  We enjoy the wine selection, appetizers, and tapas style dining.  It is very fun to order many options and share them around the table.  Be ready for lots of taste bud tantalization!  This most recent visit we took our friends from the Chicago area.  We wondered how we could impress them with all the choices they must have in a big city.  They were impressed.  Open table reservation made it very easy to book in advance on my phone.  This place is a must for your list if you have not yet visited.

Been there 4 times, gotten worse every time.  Definitely don't go on a Sunday, they were out of several menu items but we didn't find out until about 15 minutes after we originally ordered. Service was meh, still up in the air about whether or not we will ever go back

Stopped here for some cocktails during happy hour. We hung out in the lounge area around the bar. Our drinks were amazing and so was the goat cheese starter.  The place is dark inside but not in a bad way. The wait staff was pleasant and attentive. We also forgot our iPhone there for about 3 hours. Through gps tracking we found it was still at the restaurant. Our waitress must have found it and put it in the hostess desk for if we came back looking for it.  Can't wait to come back for another Lychee Martini

Food: 5 Service: 3 Uniqueness: 5  ----------------- This is arguably my wife's favorite Madison restaurant.   The food is insanely good with some unique menu items you're not going to get anywhere else. The Korean Short Rib Potstickers is a one-of-a-kind insanely delicious item! There are other really unique reinventions of things as well like the ahi tuna tacos and the pork belly over a biscuit that are just delicious.  The one minus to Eno Vino is the service can be at times poor with some of the wait staff slightly pretentious. I say that based on only 2 or 3 experiences on more than half a dozen trips so take that with a grain of salt.  This is definitely a place you want to try out for a fancy night out or a special occasion.

Finally a fine dining restaurant in Madison worth its salt!! This was my first time here so won't get too superlative with praises but well done!  Decor - Eclectic with a beautiful dim light romantic shade to it. The seating's were thankfully away from the Bar thus helping with noise reduction.  Service - Spot on!! The waitress was very sweet and knew her dishes well. Every dish was explained properly, our order was taken in the right way and she kept checking in on us every once in a while.   Food - Seductively Sumptuous!! Every plate we ordered had its own unique identity and no 2 plates conflicted with each other. Our order included - Ahi Tuna Tacos, Labelle Farm Fois Gras, Braised Belly, Korean Short Rib Pot-stickers. The tuna tacos were sooo playful with their fresh tuna pairing with a spicy-tangy jalapeno slaw. The tomato relish complimented both the subtlety of the tuna and the spiciness of the slaw. Loved it!  The fois gras was delectable!  Cooked just right, it melted away as it's meant to and when accompanied with the green apples and fig jam, creates a melody in your mouth!! The toast were thankfully moist and not crusty or crunchy and that worked very well overall.  The braised belly was a surprise!! Every single element on that dish was a star! The egg perfectly runny, the belly seasoned well, seared to perfection and melt in your mouth texture, the tomato confit really enhanced the tomato flavor and that gouda biscuit was one of the best biscuits I've had in a while! Work them together and it became a dish well worth a round of applause!!  The potstickers can be a tricky subject since I'm not a big fan of thick casings. These however, were  just right and that short rib filling was a pleasant departure from your bog standard mince pork or shrimp fillings. The pairing of Mayo, Soy and hot sauce with it really uplifted the dish.  I saved the best for last. It's their Creme Brulee dessert. But it's not about the food that makes it the best, but their gesture. Don't get me wrong, that was one of the best Creme Brulee's I've ever had (Never imagined pairing creme brulee with brownie and raspberry compote will go so well!!!). It was my birthday and we had asked if they could place a small candle on the dish when they get it out. Not only did they do that, they painstakingly wrote a sweet Happy Birthday message for me! AND gave me the dessert on the house!!!! No one has ever done that in any of the places I've dined. Very very kind of them.  This is at the top of my list of go to restaurants for Round 2 in Madison. Please do give them a try and I'm sure you wont be disappointed!!

The service here is on point!  In addition to our attentive server, the service manager was definitely on the floor and making sure customers are taken care of.  I think the service is the most notable thing about this restaurant.  You can bring a group of people here and feel certain that they will have a pleasant time.  Restrooms are classy.  When the ladies' room has lotion, mints, and brand name tampons, you know you are in a place where staff pays attention to details.  Wine list.  I'm not a wine expert by any means, but they have iPads for learning more about their selections as well as offering a full bar, of course.  I had a sparkling red wine, which is kinda crazy.  The food is good, but not memorable.  Everything is oriented towards leisurely snacking, so you can feel comfortable ordering 1-2 things at a time and sharing.  This is a great option if you want to relax  at a place a little more high end than a coffeeshop with a small group.

We stopped in for a work get together and while the company was great, the food definitely left me wanting more.  The menu is built around small plates with flatbreads and some larger dishes to choose from.  As we were part of a group, we tried two flatbreads-Thai Chicken and the Shrimp and Andouille, truffle fries, chicken skewers, calamari fries, bruschetta, and the seared sesame ahi.  Much to choose from but all were utterly unremarkable.  Nothing stood out.  Flavors didn't pop.  It was not the Eno Vino that I am used to.  Admittedly, I havent been there in over a year but perhaps now having two locations has impacted their attention to detail and execution.  They offer a large number of wines by the glass and their Super Tuscan was tasty.  Service was great for our table of 8 but I would definitely have to have my arm twisted to come back to dine again.

I adore Eno Vino. It can be a little on the pricey side depending on what you get. I love coming in when the wine bottles are half off and sharing a cheese board and one or two other random things with my boyfriend. It usually ends up being fairly priced and definitely filling.  The biggest downside to this place is the portion size. Everything is tiny. If you're looking for filling and aren't interested in the cheese board or spending a lot of money then this place isn't for you. I will say that what the dishes lack in size they almost always make up for in flavor. I've never been disappointed with a single thing I've gotten here.  I love the low lights and decor. I do miss the recent attention to the restrooms. I miss being able to get a quick spritz of Aveda hairspray before leaving. Any place that offers products, especially Aveda quality, in the restrooms wins my heart. I hope you bring it back, Eno Vino!  The wine selection is amazing. I tend not to be too adventurous when ordering at a restaurant, but there is enough of a selection to please any wine enthusiast.   The service is always amazing. Every waitress here is incredibly nice and friendly.  I would recommend anyone stop in here at least once. It may not be the place you go every week, but it will definitely end up being one of your favorite places.
Great place and fun time sharing and tasting all the great freshly prept food! Headed there Sat for the potstickers and mushroom ravioli :)) yum

I came here to try the entrees for the first time, and I am happily surprised how much I enjoyed them. The first time I came here, I wasn't blown away, but I wasn't disappointed either; I just didn't have much to say. Coming here for father's day weekend, my family was impressed and I was proud to have taken them to a restaurant they enjoyed so much.  My father loved how relaxed the environment was. We sat on the couches and sipped wine and munched on truffle fries and bruschetta while watching golf on the TV. The service was wonderful, and our server checked on us frequently and refilled our waters. Our favorite bruschetta was the beef tenderloin (we substituted the choice cheese with goat cheese - YUM!). Truffle fries? A-D-D-I-C-T-I-V-E!! We had to ask our server to box them up because we just could not stop eating.   My father ordered the pork belly, my mother: the scallops, and my boyfriend: the duck confit spring rolls. Pork belly: absolutely amazing. Pork fell apart and melted in your mouth, and the bread pairing was perfect. Scallops: I can honestly say I've had better for cheaper. It was tasty, but I don't think I can say it was worth the $27. Spring rolls: I did not enjoy one bit, but my boyfriend loved them. I personally thought they tasted a bit fishy, and my boyfriend claimed he would come back for them. In the end, we all shared the peach cobbler with ice cream on the side. Cobbler without the ice cream was pretty dry, but very delicious overall.  Overall, a very successful dinner. I am willing to come back. A little pricey, but worth it.

I have been to both this Eno Vino and the one by the capitol. We were seated in a corner area. Just like at the other Eno Vino, we ordered the calamari fries and truffle fries. We also ordered a seared scallop/sea bass and a squid-ink linguine. Everything was absolutely delicious, as always. I would say that Eno Vino handles seafood perfectly; the calamari fries are always hot and crispy. The scallop was seared to perfection and the sea bass melted in your mouth. The squid ink linguini was also delicious and there was a generous portion of clams and mussels in the dish. SO ordered a blueberry mule. He said it was tasty and refreshing.   There were two things that I wish were different. The first was we were the only table that did not receive any bread (probably just a minor oversight) and by the time we noticed, it was already into the meal. Not a big deal.  The other minor gripe I have is that this is not a place you go to if you are not prepared to spend a pretty penny. I understand that quality is what they go for, but for around $30, one scallop and a small piece of fish really was a little disappointing; I could have easily eaten 4-5 of those and still have been hungry (I wish dishes at that price point came with a little something extra, such as a bed of risotto or some mashed potatoes). Also, as a place that boasted "plates to share", dishes such as those really are hard to share.   Definitely come here for quality and delicious food, but be prepared to pay.
Went for birthday dinner for five people, super busy Friday night around 7:30 pm. Service was outstanding and tried a plethora of dishes, all were spot on.

Sample some wines before you commit to one and then stay the night munching and sipping.  Liked it a lot.  Very expensive.  Very trendy/hip.  Great people-watching.  Loud.  Disappointed with the pork belly after reading so many great things here.

This was the best dining experience I had while visiting the Madison area. It is a tapas bar, but I should note that it is not Spanish cuisine but more like a fusion of different cuisines. We came with  group of 10 and at first I thought that would not work out with the sharing. It actually worked out great and everyone ended up with full and happy bellies. Here is my ratings of the dishes we tried.  Absolute Must try: -Sea bass and scallops: my favorite of all, delicious and perfectly cooked. It is also the most expensive dish on the menu ($28) and probably least appropriate for sharing with a large group since it's only 2 scallops and a very small piece of fish. -Calamari fries: best calamari ever!! not the round and chewy calamri you might be used to, this was very tender and yummy. -Hanger steak: great and served with risotto. -Blackened mahi-mahi: this was the favorite of the table, we had to order an extra since we wanted more -Ahi Poke: very refreshing and satisfying if you like seaweed and raw tuna  Also very good: -Thai chicken pizza -Chicken skewers -Fries -Crab cake (very small and you only get 2, though)  Stay away: -Gnocchi and veal meatball: very mushy gnocchi, meatballs were nothing special -Cheese plate: for $11 you get 2 very tiny cheese wedges, not worth it with all the other great otions

Nice place with good food.  I've only been there once and it was with a very large party.  We shared a ton of different things and I liked them all.  I suppose I'm comparing this place to some pretty famous tapas restaurants in Chicago.  This wasn't as good, but it's a nice atmosphere with good food and I'd happily eat there again.

Best upscale restaurant on the west side of Madison. Love the electronica music. Was a wonderful place for my birthday and we've gone with groups which was fun as well. I always wear earplugs because it gets busy and noisy. We eat in the restaurant and they serve tapas. Kind of pricey but always worth it. The dishes are served architecture style--very decorative and arty. The comment about this being the place to take a woman if you want a second or third date is true!

I worked at Eno Vino as a waitress for just shy of three years.  It is a tapas bistro, meaning there is a large number of small dishes that you can choose for everyone at the table to share. It's decidedly pricey if you wind up doing any real eating rather than just drinking, so it's better for a luxurious evening out if that's your style. The wine list is extremely serious. Prices for wine, however, are actually very reasonable, both by the bottle and glass; you'll find that most restaurants in town sell the same bottles for more. Moreover, alhough I do not drink martinis myself they always looked darned impressive when I served them. Lots of frou frou and pointy, exciting garnish awaits you at Eno Vino.  The restaurant has changed since I worked there from a half-bar, half-restaurant to much more of a bar. You can still get dinner there, but you might want to pick a quiet evening. The bar is a zoo on Friday and Saturday nights.  I've modified this post several times over the years. It's gone from extremely detailed and enthusiastic to just enthusiastic. Eno Vino is a lovely place, but I haven't worked there since early 2008 so I'm not too clear on the details anymore as the menu and wine list have changed a good bit. I guess one of the best recommendations is that I still go there even after working there for so long. We had our bickering and in house tension like you have at all restaurants: server on server rage, chef on chef rage, owner on owner rage, manager on manager rage, bartender on bartender rage, and all the combos thereof. But in retrospect, I realize that this was probably because Eno was and is a really good restaurant. They hired smart (if occasionally vicious) people, all of whom really cared about their jobs and worked their asses off every night. So what else is new in the restaurant biz, right? Bottom line, the food was unbelievable and we all really cared about how our tables turned out. And that's still the case - the quality of food and service at Eno Vino are unmatched in Madison.   For me, I think it's the tomato soup that keeps me coming back. I ate it pretty much every night before my shift (cheapest thing on the menu) and now for me it's the flavor of my absurdly hardworking, high-living youth. Why did I have to quit? Oh right, because I wanted to become a doctor and so my adviser made me, and rightly so. But now that I actually AM a doctor I do miss being a waitress once in awhile, even if the interpersonal dynamics did leave something to be desired. I guess humans can be nostalgic about just about anything, given a reasonable supply of the right soup. I am going to get a bowl of that soup right now. It comes with truffled microgreens and a tiny grilled cheese sandwich. It is foolishly delicious. You had better try it before you die, although it won't mean the same thing to you that it does to me.  Also: the scallops are occasionally (not always - but sometimes) the size of hockey pucks. That is all.

Coming into this I wasn't expecting much.  My buddy questioned why I'm going for wine when Wisconsin is known for beer and dairy.  However, I was pleasantly surprised with the great food, service, and atmosphere. The tapas style here is perfect for sharing for groups of 2-3.  Every item we tried was enjoyable - Truffled fries - mixed bruschetta - sea bass & scallop - hanger steak & cheddar risotto - thai chicken flat bread - creme brulee  The martinis were a little on sweet side but strong.  The server was enthusiastic, friendly and informative without being overbearing.  I'm glad to have found this gem.  (avg $50-60 a pop with drinks, tax & tip)

We have had dinner at Eno Vino on Junction Road many times in the past. It's our go-to place when folks come in from out of town, birthdays, and sometimes--just because. It's not the cheapest place, but if the food is good and one is treated well, it's worth it. And we've had many evenings there with servers who took great care of us. So imagine our surprise when we went recently for my birthday, and the service was just meh. I am a person who likes birthdays--mine and others. I had noted on the reservation that we were there for a birthday. I also told our server. She didn't remark on it more than "oh." I wasn't expecting a free anything, but a happy birthday or even a candle in our dessert would've been nice. Nothing, nada, zip. Our server was polite, but not warm. She was helpful in suggesting dishes but didn't check on us once they came, and it was not a busy night. In fact, I had to ask for a new fork at one point, while she was standing up next to the bar talking to the Asst. Manager. In addition, we ordered the pear tart for dessert, and she bought spoons to eat it with--the tart had a crust that one could not cut through easily with a spoon. We couldn't get her attention, so we just took forks from the table next to us that was set. So maybe this was an off night--that's what I'm hoping--but we may give them a little break for a while.

I've been both here and their capitol location. They have very different atmospheres based on what you are looking for. This EnoVino is more of a restaurant style sit down kind of place. It is much quieter and more refined in my opinion. Take that as you will.  We ordered a couple drinks and had scallop as well as squid ink linguine. I am always craving seafood so this was a godsend. The scallop was perfectly cooked. Everything about this place is so good (except for the price)!

It pains me to update my review to 3-stars from 5-stars. I considered dropping my review to 2-stars but based on the many years of great service and a fantastic menu I'll give Eno Vino a bit of leeway.   The service has gotten unreliable ever since the opening of their downtown location. On our last several visits menu items were not available and on or last visit we weren't told this until 1/2 of our order arrived. This created the awkward situation of one of his having food in front of them and the other with nothing. So one of us just did without.   Frankly after years of loyal patronage this is all pretty disappointing. When Eno Vino is on point, it'll be a great experience - but when they aren't - we'll it'll be disappointing.

It was good but a tad slow. Had a bunch of different items however I only remember the flat bread (sausage and mushroom) which was ok but memorable for the over cooked crust that was hard as a rock. Otherwise food was fine but nothing special.
Service, food and libations are off-the-hook good.  This place rivals tapas restaurants in San Francisco and NYC.  Seriously. It's that good.
Found one of my favorite wines here: Paul Mas Malbec is delicious. Tapas also delicious, and makes for a great date spot. Nice ambiance, great wine, good food.

Let me start out by saying that this place was lucky to get one star, and it only got one star because 1) Yelp doesn't let reviewers give zero stars and 2) the wine was good.  That being said, the food here was terrible.  In fact, I was shocked that Eno Vino had 4.5 stars on Yelp, but then I listened to the other diners around us and I'm pretty sure that their palattes weren't exactly sophisticated.  Case in point, the woman behind me asked the waiter if the pork belly was really intestines.  When he explained what pork belly was, she seemed incredibly impressed.  In fact, she even said, "Fancy!" in a completely non-sarcastic way.  So maybe Eno Vino has an overly inflated rating on Yelp because its diners think the food is "fancy" and don't know how well-prepared "fancy" food like pork belly should actually taste?  Who knows.  Moving on to the food.  We ordered the following items: the lobster bisque, the tempura shrimp, the pork belly, and the duck confit risotto.  Let's start with the least offensive, which was the shrimp.  It was similar to tempura carry out from the corner Chinese place.  Not terrible, but nothing to make it really stand out.  It was essentially just decent fried shrimp.    Now things start getting offensive.  Let's begin with the pork belly.  It came topped with a soft cooked egg.  Our server made it a point to explain that the dish was presented with the egg on top for a reason - so the diner could cut into the egg and break the yolk so the runny yolk would infuse with the rest of the dish.  She emphasized how much the yolk complemented the rest of the dish.  I get it.  I love a runny yolk.  It's one of the reason I orderd the dish.  I was thinking eggs and bacon.  So you can imagine my surprise when I cut into the egg to find a hard cooked yolk.  Huh.  If that was all that was wrong with the dish, I could have at least forgotten about the egg and enjoyed the pork belly.  Unfortunately it was also covered in a congealed and unappetizing mornay sauce, which had clearly spent too much time on the warmer back in the kitchen.  Mornay sauce really isn't that hard to make, and for the prices Eno Vino charges, I'd expect it to be made to order.  Speaking of things that should be made to order, let's talk about the duck confit risotto.  Or, as it turned out to be, a slightly brown tasteless gluey mess with nuggets of duck.  Risotto should be creamy and just a little toothsome.  However, just like the mornay sauce and the egg in the pork belly dish, the risotto had clearly been made WELL ahead of time and warmed up.  It was mushy, gelatinous, and gluey.   No texture.  Plus it was incredibly bland.  Two thumbs down.  Time to discuss the most offensive dish of the night.  The lobster bisque.  I love lobster bisque.  It's rich, it's decadent, it's sweet and savory.  It's wonderful.  However, the lobster bisque at Eno Vino is some kind of Frankenstein bastard hybrid of canned turkey gravy and seafood stock base from a jar.  For one thing, lobster bisque should be creamy pinkish orange in color.  Not brown like turkey gravy, which is what the bisque at Eno Vino was.  I gave the bisque the benefit of the doubt and thought that perhaps the chef was trying to add depth of flavor by incorporating a dark roux.  Nope.  The bisque tasted and had the consistency of fishy canned gravy.  It also came with rubbery overcooked *crab* legs, which was interesting since it was *lobster* bisque.  But I digress.  The bisque was a fail of epic proportions.    To add insult to injury, this meal, along with a couple glasses of wine for my husband and I, still added up to about $100.  I could have complained about the crap food to my server, but what was the point?  My server recommended some of these things, so she obviously wouldn't know good food if it jumped up and bit her in the behind.  I learned my very expensive lesson at Eno Vino.  What a disappointment.

My partner took me here six years ago for a first date.  I eventually brought her here to ask her to marry  me.  The atmosphere is intoxicating, yet exuberant. Romantic, yet still exciting. The open kitchen can transform their customers into their audience.  The wine list alone is the draw. But the food will have you coming back for years.  I want to point out that their goat cheese in marinara is my least favorite app. Not worth the $9. The fact that I value their $11 truffled fries should say something.  I've tried seafood throughout Madison. I've enjoyed lobster in Maine, Patagonian toothfish in New York, crab in New Orleans and clams in San Francisco. And yet the Day Boat Scallops here at Eno Vino continue to be one of my favorite dishes. Not better than others, but best among dishes in the area.  The duck confit is en pointe; the hanger steak (rare) is delicious...Just enjoy yourself at this lovely restaurant in Middleton.
Great atmosphere and yummy food! My favorite on the menu is the Hearth Oven Flatbread with Spicy Shrimp And Andouille jalape√±o cream, roasted peppers and mozzarella- absolutely delicious!

Italian-style restaurant for small plates.  The hostess us greeted with a smile. Nice, cozy decor. Romantic atmosphere. Great, friendly service. Ordered the cheese board with choice of 4 cheeses. Absolutely fantastic.  Also ordered the scallops. In a word, amazing. They were fresh and tender, not rubbery, full of flavor.  The manager came by to check on us which is always appreciated.  The only thing that threw me off is the ipad for the wine list. To me, it's just.....wrong. The ipad doesn't fit the ambiance or the mood of the place.  Very happy with the quality of the food, the service, the speed, and the overall experience. Will definitely return.

I was and still am very impressed with the food,wine selection, an great service @Eno vino, A very nice greeting and host to start it off, Very classy darkly lit atmophere sets the mood while deliciously wonderful smells fill the room.  Service was second to none. Personal ipad for the wine selection makes for a easy and tech savey way to browse they're magnificiant wine selection. As for the food ,every single dish has its own uniqe flavor , with each dish you are set on " this is my favorite" but as the next plate comes you realize "wait no this is my favorite". The price is jus right,maybe alittle pricey for some but you definently get what yu pay for that's forsure.The service is very knowledgeable and very helpful.To me its what classy resturaunt should be. One of my favorite places in WI.Id definently recomend it to everyone!

This place is an absolute must try!!!! If you like innovative food, more selections of wine than you can count, great signature drinks, and top notch service, not to mention the ambiance is great for a girls night out or a definite date night, You must try Eno Vino...My boyfriend and I are regulars here and love, love, love it!!!

Well .....I had a lot of expectations as I remember this place as "great" This visit was not "great" Not at all Brochuta- good Plus  The special duck - excellent Taco Tuna - not "very good" Ahi tuna - very very good Sangeria - well.....1/2 cheap win with 1/2 water and slice of watermelon doesn't do the job. It was poor - very poor.  Service? What just happen here! We arrived - no one is waiting in the entrance .... We had to ask to replace the plates. It's obvious when you eat tapas style - no? Not here! And - I had special request for Birthday cake - but no one bother to take care of it.  I remember this restaurant as 5 stars. But this visit was maybe 3 stars - also the price remain at 5 stars level.  In one word: disappointed

Six of us had dinner tonight.  The cheese tray was great, and so were the truffle fries.  The crab cakes were small for the price.  Everyone enjoyed the chicken skewers.   Was surprised how cold it was and how empty. There were small things they could have done to make things better for our large party like bringing two little plates the toasts instead of a single plate down at one end.  I will say that everyone enjoyed what they ordered so small improvements could greatly improve my rating.

I'll admit, I wasn't excited about the idea of going to Eno Vino.  I'm not really a Tapas kind of guy as I picture a fufu plate with already small servings that I now have to share.  My wife suggested it many times and I regularly leaned against it.  Wow, what a bone-headed move that was...I've unfortunately been missing out on something great.  I found myself enjoying each plate that we ordered.  I found the flavors were original and complex and really did enjoy it.  We ordered three main items, the bruschetta, chicken on sticks (my term, not theirs), and Pork Belly.  In addition to these items, the bread / garlic butter that is served with the meal was also great.  We also had the Red Velvet cake for dessert, which was also good.  When we were leaving, my wife said we should come here more often and I responded with "how about next Friday".  I walked away full and excited about this new found dinner destination.

Very unique Italian Tapas & Vino restaurant.   Liked the wine list on an iPad, quartino servings in a wobbly glass and cocktail list (particularly the Gin Yummy).  The server recommended 2 dishes per person, but I'd say you really need 1 1/2.  Easy to share.  We ordered 9 different dishes and  enjoyed the flank steak, bacon fries and goat cheese appetizer the best!

I have been going to Eno Vino since it opened.  If you are looking for a top notch wine bar this is the place to go.  They sell more wine than any other bar/restaurant in Madison.  They have a huge selection that can't be matched anywhere else.  The food is exceptional compared to most places in Madison.  I'm suprised to hear people have complaints about the food.  I have dined here hundreds of times and if you want my suggestions on small plates that will never let you down try these: 1)  Seared Sesame Tuna 2)  Sea Bass and Scallops 3)  Thai Chicken Flatbread 4) Littleneck Clams Give this place a try and you'll be hooked.

I always forget how much I enjoy Eno Vino. The food is a good take on modern American bistro cuisine, and they always have a decent number of gluten-free selections on their menu. Their waitstaff is friendly and attentive, without being overly so, and knowledgable.  Most of the time, my friends and I each order a couple of the small plates and share everything (their "small plates" are not always "small" - the value for price is good here.)  One of my favorite items on the menu is the pork shank. It's fall-off-the-bone tender, all on a bed of napa cabbage, a cranberry agrodolce (sweet & sour sauce) and topped off with fried lentils for a nice crunch.  Noise level varies depending on when you're there -- Friday and Saturday nights (when I most often go) tend to be on the louder side, especially after 7pm.  My only request is that they stop eliminating GF options when they change up their menu -- we want more options, not less! A GF bread option, so I could order bruschetta, or their flatbreads, would also be nice. (I'd be happy to pay a small surcharge for the option.)

The food here is superb. I've tried almost every vegetarian/ pescetarian item on the menu and they're all delicious. You really can't go wrong with anything they serve here.  My only complaint is that the menu isn't really well designed? Like it's a little hard to read and navigate and kind of challenging to find what I'm looking for. Other than that, the decor is very modern and upscale and the service is excellent. Slightly fancier than casual atmosphere.

I am fortunately to live so close to such a delightful tapas wine bar. Anytime I don't feel like cooking or going out for an elaborate meal (yes, sometimes I'm too lazy to eat), I find myself here, and i order the same three items every time: the lobster bisque, mushroom ravioli, sea bass and scallops.  The quality of the food, from its ingredients, recipe, to its execution, is flawless. They're especially adapt at cooking seafood. The sea bass and scallops are always cooked to perfection - a little crisp on the outside with a buttery mouthfeel. It's orgasmic.   If you have kids, I recommend the mushroom ravioli. It's topped with a port wine reduction and truffle oil. My 4 yo can't get enough of that stuff.   I haven't explored their wine list as every time I go it's lazy mom's night with the kid, but if any fellow yelpers have recommendations for a good, full bodied red, please let me know!

Disclaimer: I've only been for the drinks, and I've never sampled the food.  On the drinks alone, this place gets two stars.  The mixed drinks are weak, albeit pretty good tasting.  I've sampled a number of different drinks, and none blew me away.  The happy hour prices are a nice deal (all day sundays, m-f 4-7).  You get $2 off wines by the glass and $ 2 off "modest sippers."  There are also food deals.    ****One big annoyance....which is a minor thing, but unbelievably stupid policy on their part.... they don't "do" happy hour if you want to sit outside.....WHY?!  You have a large outdoor seating area (which looks out on the parking lot....), but you won't give the $2 off drinks outside....I've thought about it, and I just don't get the policy here.  Is it really not worth your time to just have a server walk the extra 10 feet outside?  It just seems stingy.  If i'm paying four bucks for your watered down sugar drinks, just let me enjoy it outside as I admire the all those pretty cars that your upscale wine bar looks out on.  This place is filling the classy, wine bar niche in the otherwise beer-saturated Madison.  If you're looking at exploring some wines, and have some cash, give it a whirl.
Nice service at the bar and happy hour all day Sunday!
Been here twice and liked it both times. The salads and flatbreads are good. Tapas - the ahi poke and the hangar steak are good. Tried the jean-luc colombo chateauneuf-du-pape which was excellent.

We have visited enoVino before and always loved it. One night we came and it was pretty disappointing. Food was salty, no better than a chain restaurant. We had always loved the bruschetta options, but this night we get like we spent $16 on 4 pieces of toast with barely any toppings. Service was very nice, but I'm afraid that the food was so bad for the cost that I can't imagine we will ever return. Time to find a new favorite restaurant!

I really enjoyed the atmosphere at Eno Vino--it's definitely on par with some of my favorite Chicago hotspots. My sister and I went for some good old fashioned liquid dessert, aka Key Lime Pie martinis. We also shared the cheese plate: warm Fontina fondue, along with aged goat, blue, cheddar and gouda cheeses, and the Shitaki Ravioli, which featured a really nice Foie Gras sauce -- yum!  Note that they're currently undergoing construction due to expansion; we ended up perched on stools at the bar next to a very large tarp, but didn't notice any noise or drafty conditions. And yes, as some other reviewers mentioned, the strip mall location is somewhat disconcerting, but two drinks in you'll forget all about the neighboring Jiffy-Lube.

Excellent and nicely plated food. Most of our dishes were exceptionally tasty (though the dumplings were merely good). A few of the small plates (e.g., grilled octopus) were so meager that sharing was impractical - even though the menu header states "to share" and the prices suggest a more generous portion.  Considering this is a wine bar, the staff seemed lacking in knowledge on their wines. Recommend.

I get to Madison a couple times a year and we are always looking for a new place to run up the expense account.  Eno Vino can certainly deliver a pretty swanky meal.  We had a couple of good bottles of wine accompanied by some great dishes.  As others have said the beef tenderloin was awesome as was the Sesame Tuna.  What confused me a little was the portion size.  We asked our server if the servings were really a tapas style, small plate type of thing and she said yes, order 2-3 small plates per person.  We ended up with way too much food, the servings were pretty good sized.  I am use to tapas being very small plates and sharing them with the table.  This place seems to have almost entry sized portions.  I would suggest ordering a couple to get started and then placing another order if you are style hungry.

Their Sea Bass and Scallop dish with verjus is the best thing I've ever eaten. Two words: Tomato Jam.   It is not cheap, but worth the money. I look forward to returning and highly recommend it.   I tried foie gras for the first time ever and was impressed. Both times I have been here (had the Sea Bass and Scallop dish both times... it's THAT good) we tried a cheese plate. The first time we asked our server what kind was good and she suggested the Bellavitano. I still feel like I owe her for this. A friend and I joke that Bellavitano brings people together.The second time we had that and the Moody Blue. Also a find.   If you are looking for a quality, delicious dinner and are not concerned with the price, Eno Vino is your answer.

As the author of the Essential Guide to Prescription Drugs, I travel a lot doing consulting and eat out a lot. I've eaten at the bar, at a table at the chef's table and again at the chef's table at this restaurant. WOW. Great meals and awesome service 4 times now. Love any of their scallop dishes, fish is great and I probably will go back on Friday. It's rare that someone in such a busy place remembers your name, but I returned with a business client and there was the manager Jennifer welcoming me back and remembering my name! When I sat at the chef's table, two of the waitresses also said hi and remembered my name as well. It's smart to get a reservation as it is busy, but any effort you make is well worth it. The only thing I haven't tried is dessert, but they also have a strong selection of ports and other after dinner drinks. Make the time to visit--I bet you'll go back.

This place is excellent! Fun atmosphere, great wine list and incredible food! The one thing I always order to start out with is the bruschetta, it's the best I've had anywhere. The braised pork ribs are also excellent and if the duck confit crepes are on the menu, you MUST order them. I've been here three times and each time was a 5 star experience!

If you've read more than a handful of Yelp reviews, you've probably run across at least one review that starts out with " I really wanted to like this place more".  Fear not gentle reader, this is not one of those reviews.  In fact, it's just the opposite.  I like this place more than I feel I should.  Despite being housed in a west side strip mall, despite no information on the sourcing of their ingredients, despite the bizarre fusion of wine bar and sports bar elements, I keep coming back.  Why, you ask?  They offer creative food with exceptional service in an intimate setting  Every time I've visited, my wife and I have left content.  And there are very few places in Madison that I can say that about.  Things I like:  * Want to feel like a rock star? The attentive service at Eno Vino will make you feel like one.  The entire staff really seems focused on creating the best possible experience for the patrons.  More than anything else, this is keeps drawing me back.   * I adore the humble simplicity of the Charred Hot House Tomato Soup.  It may be the lowest priced item on the menu, but this dish never fails to amaze.  Intense tomato flavor that is perfectly complimented by a mini grilled cheese sandwich.  Highly recommended!   * A wine list that's twelve freakin' pages long.  It has a great mix of varietals and regions.  If you feel overwhelmed by all the choices, the servers and bartenders have offered some great recommendations.  I also recommend utilizing the wine flights as a way to sample some out of the ordinary.   *  I appreciate the wide variety of menu choices.  Usually I get nervous when I see a wide variety of cuisines represented on the menu.  But kitchen at Eno Vno does a pretty decent job of representing the various cuisines of Asia, Europe and the Americas. When I have a disappointing dish, it's more the result of poor execution than of poor concept.     * Overall, I enjoy the ambiance.  Once I enter, I immediately forget that I'm in a strip mall.  Romantic lighting levels, the fireplace by the bar, the warm color palette of the decor make it a great date night location.  While others have complained about the noise level, I've never experienced that problem when seated at the the chef's table or the bar area.    Things I don't like:  * Black hole, meet wallet.  A couple glasses of wine, several appetizers and a dessert will likely set you back $100.  Eno Vino adheres to a quality over quantity philosophy, which you'll noticed when it comes time to pay the bill.   * For a restaurant that focuses on food quality, I'm surprised they don't indicate where they are sourcing their ingredients.  They may adhere to a farm-to-table philosophy like many of the other finer, local dining establishments, but the menu or the website does not shed any insights.  When I go to Graze, I know exactly where the items on the cheese board came from, not so at Eno Vino.   * For the love of god, ditch the TVs in the bar area.  Do you really think showing SportsCenter adds to the ambiance?  I didn't think so.   * I'm surprised there haven't been more road rage incidents in the parking lot as the strip mall patrons race each other to find an open parking spot.  Be prepared to spend time hunting for a parking spot.  Despite these imperfections, I still am a huge fan of Eno Vino.

A huge thank you to the wonderful Eno staff for hosting Yelp's Social Hour this week.  I had a fabulous time (kicking my friend's butt at the one-person tricky triangle game..harhar) trying out the Happy Hour menu and enjoying the relaxing, buzz-happy atmosphere.  The food was fantastic. For a wine bar, Eno definitely has all the finger food-y goodness of a neighborhood pub - but with three times the class and five times the number of items on the menu. ;) My friends and I split the calamari and the spicy shrimp & andouille pizza. My friends ravedddd about the calamari, but I think I was mostly amused by the shape of the calamari fries. I was actually much more impressed by the combination of seafood and sausage on the pizza.  I also ordered the strawberry&peach fresh enofusion martini. I probably drank it much faster than I should have - seriously, an adult beverage in a...martini glass shaped.... juice box.  The service was extremely attentive and patient (i always take forever to decide on menu items at a new place..). Plus, I can always appreciate a restaurant manager who greets their regulars by name. (:   I will definitely be back to try out the full menu. See you soon, Eno!
Excellent food and wine. Wish the wine flights would change more frequently! Friendly staff! Thai chicken pizza and sesame seared tuna are amazing.

I've been to Eno Vino dozens of times now and it's always the first place that comes to mind when I want to grab an awesome drink or bite to eat.  I adore their drinks: The All Natural martini is my go to, but I love the PB&J and Blueberry Cobbler too.  My bf and I generally always start with the Ahi Tuna, but recently have moved to their awesome mussels.  They change up their menu every so often and I am never disappointed when they do.  We went a few days ago and had their duck special and it was AMAZING.  I always get the scallops and would happily eat them everyday if I could.  Their hanger steak is a must too, the mashed potatoes underneath are awesome.  The waitstaff is always very knowledgeable and prompt.  We generally finish up with the fondue and I somehow always have enough room to finish it.  It's a little spendy but I feel like you get so much amazing food that it's well worth it.  The decor and seating is great too.  I have no complaints about Eno, I'll be back again soon!

I love this place!  I found Eno Vino on the last day of my trip to Madison for work and had I known about it before, I would have been here every night.  Their happy our is amazing!  The waitstaff was very knowledgeable about the wine list and menu and kind.  The food was delicious.  My friends and I shared too many plates to name but I highly recommend the ahi tuna tacos, truffle fries, thai chicken pizza and the Magdelena Zinfandel.

Way fun, way yummy, way fancy.  In the arena of fine dining in Madison, this place is one of those outliers that is not right next to the capitol.  It is about 8 miles west in Middleton.  My mother swooped into town to ease my broken heart.  An evening at Eno Vino with my mom and a gf fit the bill....well it didn't hurt.  Taste buds dance in delight, food looks like art, and you just melt into your seat.  Get the fondue thing for dessert. Swoon. See pic.

Fantastic. I expect great food in Chicago, but you guys in Wisconsin are keeping secrets over here! Between an appetizer with baked goat cheese and basil and an entree of scallops and black figs atop slices of French toast soaked in truffle butter, you have pretty much covered all my favorite foods. The Sage Advice mixed drink was OUTSTANDING as well. Kudos! I will be back the next time I'm in Madison!

This used to me our favorite restaurant in Madison. We were in college and this was the place to celebrate special occasions and have many good memories in this restaurant. We even returned few years after college and still loved it.   Atmosphere (4/5): Many different types or seating  completely open kitchen which feels good. Fancy and classic at that time. I don't know how it would feel now since last time we visited was about 3-4 years ago.   Service (5/5): Always their server was so friendly and nice. We remembered our favorite server's name for a while. Sometimes the manager came by and asked about food which was nice. Always good experience and cannot complain on this.   Food (5/5): wanted to give 4.5 but I kind of have to give five. Current menu doesn't have many items we used to like. Their fried calamari was definitely best ever. It felt almost like cheese stick with enough wine! Their scallops with figs and garlic bread tasted always great. Their duck dish was also divine. They kept developing new menus which was very exciting. One time we ordered churro and it cam out covered with cinnamon sugar and the manager asked how it was. We said it was too much or sugar and was too sweet. Next time we went, it came out plain without any sugar. I don't know if it was because they remembered us or they just changed the menu. It was better with a lot of sugar but cannot comment on it more. I'm sure they found a better replacement on their menu by now.   Price (4/5): We were in college without much money but this is tapas place where you can order many if small plates as you want. Their price is definitely great for the food and the portions were generous for a tapas place.   If we ever visit Madison again, we will probably come here for dinner.

Oh man.  If you have a special occasion evening that requires a fancy place to eat, THIS IS THE PLACE.  Every time I come home to Madison from California I stop in with my fiance. It's just so good.  We love everything about it here.  One of our favorite things is getting the combination of 4 bruschetta.  Every bite is an incredible combination of flavors with sweet and savory items to try.  It might not be on the square or where you would expect such a great place to be located but I guarantee it will be one of the best places you eat in the state of Wisconsin.

Good food, awesome service, and really nice ambiance! I haven't explored the wine list too much yet, so I can't really say anything about it other than it is extensive and the full list is on an iPad.  I've been here twice now, once for dinner and the second time for dessert and coffee. I was most impressed by the service both times. The servers have good suggestions for what to order and how much to order (really nice when a place serves small plates and you don't know what "small" really means).   The food is delicious, but be prepared to spend a lot. I noticed they have some pretty good happy hour specials on weekday evenings and all day Sunday, so I think next time I go for food I'll go during happy hour. The plates are significantly cheaper ($8-10 instead of $19-24).   Their desserts are awesome...I especially liked the strawberry rhubarb crisp.  Overall this is a nice place to come to for drinks and appetizers/dessert, or for a special occasion dinner.

That this place has the same star average as L'etoile is utterly unbelievable. Literally, I do not believe it. I'm tempted to run through all 171/159 reviews and calculate the averages myself because there is no way that is an accurate reflection of the world. Eno Vino might be the best place on Junction Road in Middleton, but that's about as far as I'm willing to take it.  I just don't get the mad love for this place. The staff was super friendly and knowledgeable, it's true. They will give you a sample of any wine if you are unsure and that is very nice. The restaurant is dark which may qualify it as romantic for some, okay. And they have happy hour. All good.   But I hated the space. It felt fake. It felt like walking through an open house that has obviously been staged. No character, no soul, just a bunch of dark wood and overstuffed leather, just like everyplace else. Not my scene.   And though I only had 2 bruschettas, neither did their job of whetting my appetite and making me hungry for more. Served on pillowy bread with the texture of Wonder bread, I could not discern any flavor in either one. I'm not sure there was actually any brie on the brie fig bruschetta. None was visible under the mound of julienned apple shreds and certainly I could not taste any. The 1/16th of a teaspoon of fig jam easily got lost on the cottony bread. The caprese bruschetta was better, but only marginally so and only b/c of the balsamic drizzle which at least provided a little bit of flavor.  Perhaps that's my fault for ordering something with tomatoes in the dead of winter; but if you can't deliver it, don't offer it.  Will I be back? Probably. It's like a block away from my house and this really is the best place on Junction Road. But I'll only be back for a glass of wine after I've already eaten.

There is something about this location of Eno Vino that makes me feel so classy when I walk into it. The dim lighting and cozy tables make it the perfect place for an intimate dinner.   To begin with, the parking can be very chaotic and hard to find even though there is a parking lot. But don't let that discourage you.   Secondly, the wine selection they have is extensive, and they have a wonderful selection of cocktails and beers. If you have any questions, your server can help you with that!  In addition, the tapas here are to die for. Everytime I think of the bruschetta they have, the green beans, the flatbreads, and the ahi tuna tacos my mouth just waters. I adore everything they serve here and it's delicious.   Finally, the service here is great! I always feel well taken care of when I am here, and they always have answers for my questions.

I love Eno Vino! This is the perfect spot for getting together with your girlfriends or for date night!   The Fig Mule (not sure if that is on the menu or was a drink special) was AMAZING. Of course, the wine list is wonderful. I love going with someone else and picking plates to share. The brushettas are amazing. Chicken Skewers are very yummy!   My favorite thing about this place is their Wine & Tapas Wednesdays. Every Wednesday they have a 3-course tapas event, each course being paired with wines. Best part - it is a steal at only $35. I highly recommend!   Only negative: parking lot can be full at peak times.  EDIT: since I've posted the first review they opened up their downtown location. May be the best view in Madison. We ate here one afternoon when a storm was passing through. So cool!
Great food and friendly, honest servers. A bit too loud, but you won't notice it once you start indulging.

I was visiting Madison for work.  This place was recommended to me by some locals.  En Vino is kind of tucked away, but it's kind of better that way I feel like.  If it was downtown, you'd probably wait even longer for a table.    Excellent tapas-style selection, excellent choices of alcohol and cocktails.    Alex served us and she was great, attended to all of our stupid requests.   Kind of dark - can't really see the food I'm enjoying.  If that's the goal, they hit it on the nose.
We like to come here on special occasions since it is a bit pricey. The food and drink selections are all so good. We are even having our rehearsal dinner here.

A truly wonderful dinner.  Three wine tastings before we ordered a bottle, which Elise the sommilier selected, was spot on with the seared tuna platter and a beautifully dish of prepared beets with fennel and pomegranate.  Our server Joanna is the gracefull server that everyone enjoys; attentive, smiling, helpful and not pushy.  Plan to take your time enjoying the nuances of Eno Vino and you will go home with a smile and great memories.
The food was so good! I would recommend getting the potstickers. I believe I ordered about 5 plates. I just couldn't resist myself. It was delicious.
